data.title: Why did Franklin Roosevelt spend so much time
data.meta_description: [Solved] Why did Franklin Roosevelt spend so much time in Georgia Roosevelt used the warm mineral waters of Warm Springs to ease his polio suffering
data.text:
Which of the following is TRUE regarding FDRs relationship with GeorgiaRoosevelt had to end his visits to Georgia after he contracted polio and was confined to a wheelchairHe was extremely unpopular in Georgia and never won a majority of votes in the stateRoosevelt never visited Georgia but was glad Georgia was a segregated societyHe was loved by many in Georgia thanks to his New Deal programs and visits to Warm Springs

Answered step-by-step

1 answer

SOUEAS Adote Acrobur 0847 Time Remuiring Return 8 2 points Which of the following rights did Franklin Roosevelt propose in his Second Ball of Rights specch There may be multiple answers The right to a job The right to healthcare The right to a home The right to vacation time The right to an education 4 5 Previous 6 7

Answered step-by-step

1 answer

In a survey of US adults with a sample size of 2027 312 said Franklin Roosevelt was the best president since World War II Two nbsp US adults are selected at random from this sample without replacement (a) Find the probability that both adults say Franklin Roosevelt was the best president since World War II (b) Find the probability that neither adult says Franklin Roosevelt was the best president since World War II (c) Find the probability that at least one of the two adults says Franklin Roosevelt was the best president since World War II (d) Which of the events can be considered nbspunusual Explain Select all that apply The event in part (b) is unusual because its probability is less than or equal to 005 None of these events are unusualNone of these events are unusual The event in part left parenthesis a right parenthesis is unusual because its probability is less than or equal to 005 The event in part (a) is unusual because its probability is less than or equal to 005 The event in part (c) is unusual because its probability is less than or equal to 005

Answered step-by-step

1 answer
